ovdesc.p: EB.EXTERNAL.USER is an application holding details about users of the system who are not staff of the bank. Examples include Internet banking users.

desc.p: Allowed customer associated with the channel permission.
Validation
Should be defined only if associated channel permission is defined.
Should be a valid record in CUSTOMER application.
DATE.FORMAT field is used for deciding in which format the dates are to be displayed for a user.
Validation Rules
Valid values are 1, 2, 3 and 4.
Define the group from which the permissions shall be inherited for the external user
Validation Rules
Should be a valid record in CHANNEL.PERMISSION
Should be allowed for all kind of users
Indicates the Language in which the System should communicate with this User. All messages, instructions, Help Text etc. will be displayed when possible in the Language indicated by this definition.
This field specifies the routines that needs to be triggered when the user successfully logs in.
Validation Rules
The routines entered should have a record on the EB.API application
Standard multi-value field
Access status of the user
ACTIVE: User can use the system, provided they try to access the system within their access start and end dates.
INACTIVE: User has not yet been activated.
BARRED: The user has barred from using the system.
INITIATED : User can activate their access.
The time on the first day (START.DATE) that the user can use the system.
Holds a numeric value between 0 to 4 indicating the status of the user record creation in Authentication Server
0 - user record created successfully in Authentication server
1 - user record not created in Authentication Server
2 - Communication does not exist between Authentication server and T24
3 - Internal Error
The AA product line for this arrangement
Last day the user can use the system. If they try after this, they will get a security violation and a message will be logged in the PROTOCOL file detailing why they could not log in.
Reset the Password of the EXTERNAL user in Authentication Server
Move the PASSWORD status in the Authentication Server to PENDING
Updates the customer information in Authentication server when any change is made to the existing customer records.
E.g. NAME,ADDRESS,CITY,COUNTRY,POSTCODE
This field determines the Type of Transaction Signing.
Valid settings in this field are;
SMS : One Time Password (OTP) will be sent to the Mail or Mobile as configured in the Authentication server
Token : User will use the token given to generate One Time Password(OTP)
The type of login method. Valid values from EB.LOOKUP. Ex: Password/MemWord/PIN/OTP etc.
Whether the user has accepted the Terms and Conditions first displayed when the user logs in to the system for the very first time.
The date when the password was changed
The duration in which the password is to be reviewed by the user
The Type of the user. Valid values are :-
CORPORATE
INTERMEDIARY
PERSONAL
The USER.TYPE can be manually changed (or automatically defaulted in the Version)from Intermediary to Corporate, if a Corporate user is being created
The time on the last day (END.DATE) that the user can use the system.
The companies the user can access
The user's name
Any overrides raised when this record was authorised.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
The type of authentication for this external user. Valid values are :-
External - External authentication via an authentication services such as 4Tress.
User Maintained - Maintained by the user with a simpla user name and password.
Reset the PIN of the EXTERNAL user in the Authentication Server.
Move the PIN status in the Authentication Server to PENDING.
Field takes the EB.LDAP.PARAMETER record id as the value
When selected, will create a user record in the Authentication server
User id will be same as EB.EXTERNAL.USER id in the Authentication Server.
Eg.: 4TRESS

Encrypted memorable data of the user
A defined channel for communication for this external user (e.g. INTERNET)
Field takes any value .
Value should be prefixed with CN= <anyname>
The duration that the user last used the system
The ID of this external user.
First day the user can use the system. If they try before this, they will get a security violation and a message will be logged in the PROTOCOL file detailing why they could not log in.
The password set for the user's login
Last date and time the user last logged in
The customer the user can access. This is a NOCHANGE field
Last time the system was used by the user
The AA.ARRANGEMENT record that the user on which an arrangement has been arrived at between the bank and the user. For example, the INTERNET SERVICES arrangement
Counter of the number of consecutive incorrect passwords the user has actually entered, since last entering a correct password.
This field to determine the attributes that are associated with a particular user.
Valid settings in this field are;
PREAUTHENTICATED: When selected will skip the password validation in T24 for the respective EXTERNAL user.
Field will be updated by T24 on creation of a external user in T24.
Field will hold T24 date as the value.
It is a no input field.
